elements.title: Coccinellidae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that certain Coccinellidae species (example pictured) lay extra infertile trophic eggs along with their fertile eggs so that their larvae can have a backup food source?

elements.title: Shana Yardan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the poetry collection of Guyanese radio presenter Shana Yardan was described as "accomplished, tough-minded and well-crafted"?

elements.title: The Widows of Culloden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the runway show for the Alexander McQueen collection The Widows of Culloden ended with an illusion of Kate Moss that brought the audience to a rowdy standing ovation?

elements.title: Richard Gerald Jordan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Richard Gerald Jordan has been sentenced to death four times?

elements.title: Farha (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the film Farha, which depicts the killing of a Palestinian family by Israeli soldiers during the Nakba, became the subject of a downvoting campaign?

elements.title: Junior Colson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Junior Colson, the leading tackler on the 2022 Michigan Wolverines football team, lived in a Haitian orphanage prior to his adoption at age nine?

elements.title: municipalities of Cantabria (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some people who are not Spanish citizens have the right to vote in elections for local public officials in the municipalities of Cantabria?

elements.title: Zhang Congzheng (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chinese physician Zhang Congzheng reportedly cured a man of his insanity by tying him to a rotating wheel until he vomited?
